topic: How to Journal for Mindfulness and Presence

dialog.text: How can I journal for mindfulness and presence in just a few minutes a day?
dialog.instructions: Curious, open; soft voice; slow to medium pace; gentle emphasis on 'presence'.

dialog.text: Try five minutes at the same time daily. Use three prompts: notice, feel, release. Write continuously, with no edits.
dialog.instructions: Calm, clear; steady pace; concise phrasing; encouraging tone.

dialog.text: But what if my mind keeps wandering during those minutes?
dialog.instructions: Worried but seeking reassurance; soft; inquisitive; slight hesitation.

dialog.text: Wandering is part of the practice. Name the thought, take a slow breath, and return to your prompts.
Any tip to stay present after I finish the journal?
dialog.instructions: Hopeful; curious; steady cadence; minimal but thoughtful.

dialog.text: Close with one calm breath and a single insight. Try it, and share what you noticed in the comments to inspire others.
dialog.instructions: Encouraging; warm; confident; final call to action; inviting smile in tone.
